result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan M Barbian was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ryan M Barbian is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ryan M Barbian was found guilty of Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Ryan M Barbian was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Bond applied and balance of court costs due during probation term. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

-AODA and any counseling/treatment deemed appropriate.
-No controlled substances or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription.
-Random tests.
-Submit DNA sample.
-Maintain employment of at least 24 hours or attend school with 12 credits.
-Pay supervision fees.
Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08
